p: The COVID-19 pandemic remains a serious global challenge. Research into diagnostic tests for SARS CoV-2 continues to progress ( 4); however, care must be taken in evaluating the tests and interpreting their outcomes ( 5). The main diagnostic tool is real-time PCR (RT-PCR) with samples such as nasal swabs, tracheal aspirate or bronchoalveolar lavage. Computed tomographic images help in diagnosis as well as follow-up ( 6).
